preference.name: Dialogue System
preference.description: Selecting this item will enable communication with a Natural Language system. The system may not be available at all times or with all tutors.

preference.name: Invoke Browser on External URL
preference.description: If this item is selected, then whenever a student action traverses a specially-marked link in the Behavior Graph, the system will try to invoke the machine's default web browser. The URL for the browser is formed from the External URL for Link Traversal (below) and link-specific data.

preference.name: External URL for Edge Traversal
preference.description: This item gives the system-wide fixed portion of the URL for the Invoke Browser on External URL preference (above).

preference.name: Login Window
preference.description: If this item is set, then the login window will be used to ask the student to enter a login name for the purpose of logging. Otherwise, the system user name will be used. This option applies only when the user interface is built from CTAT Java components.

preference.name: Student Confirm Quit Question
preference.value: Do you want to save your work and log out?
preference.description: This is the text displayed on a confirmation dialogue when the student tries to quit a Java tutor. If empty, then no confirmation dialogue is shown.

preference.name: Show Tutor Type Save Popup
preference.description: If this item is selected, then attempting to save a graph (brd file) with a new Tutor Type will prompt the display of a confirmation dialog.

preference.name: Projects Directory
preference.description: This folder, together with the folders within it, is the default top-level location for files created while authoring. If the value is a relative pathname, it is relative to the folder from which the current student interface was loaded ${studentInterface.url}. If the value is empty or no interface is loaded, the location is relative to the current working directory ${user.dir}.

preference.name: Problem Directory
preference.description: This folder is the location for files to be read while executing. Unless explicitly set, it is the folder from which the current Java-language student interface was loaded ${studentInterface.url} or the location of the last behavior graph loaded.

preference.name: EnableLogService
preference.description: If set, then log messages received by the Tutoring Service from a Flash tutor will be saved in the Disk Logging Directory specified below.

preference.name: EnableLogForwarding
preference.description: If the Logging Service is enabled, then enabling this preference will cause the Tutoring Service to also forward log messages to the Logging Server URL specified below.

preference.name: Use OLI Logging
preference.editor_label: Log to Remote Server (Java or Flash tutors)
preference.description: If set, then logging messages will be generated by the Java server and sent to the log server whose address is in the Logging Server URL specified below. Note: For Flash tutors this is an alternative to forwarding via the Logging Service (above), but the log entries will lack client-side time and hint information.

preference.name: Use Disk Logging
preference.editor_label: Log to Disk (Java or Flash tutors)
preference.description: If set, then logging messages will be generated by the Java server and recorded in disk files in the Disk Logging Directory specified below. Note: For Flash tutors this is an alternative to logging via the Logging Service (above), but the log entries will lack client-side time and hint information.

preference.name: enableAuthorLogging
preference.description: If set, then author actions will be logged when logging is turned on.

preference.name: OLI Logging URL
preference.description: The network address of the logging server.

preference.name: Disk Logging Directory
preference.description: The path name for the directory in which disk logging files will be stored. If the value is a relative pathname, it is relative to the current directory where the authoring tools (or Tutoring Service) was started. The value "." (dot, by itself) indicates this directory. The current directory is ${user.dir}.

preference.name: Case Sensitive
preference.description: If this item is set, then the student's input must match the case of the demonstrated input when using the Exact Matcher. Otherwise, the input case is ignored. Matchers other than Exact Matcher are not affected.

preference.name: suppressStudentFeedback
preference.description: This item determines if and when tutor feedback (hints and correct/incorrect indications) is displayed to the student. With the default setting, Show All Feedback, the tutor displays feedback immediately as the student works each step. With Hide All Feedback, the tutor never displays feedback; this can be useful, for instance, in quizzes. With Delay Feedback, the tutor will display feedback only when the student presses the Done button, and then only if the problem is incomplete because some steps are incorrect or left undone.

preference.name: Commutativity
preference.description: If this item is set, the student can perform the actions in the behavior graph in any order. Otherwise, the actions must be performed in the order shown in the graph.

preference.name: hintPolicy
preference.description: This item determines how hints are chosen in example-tracing tutors. With the default setting, Use Both Kinds of Bias, the tutor will first try to choose a hint that addresses a student's immediately-preceding error, then try for a hint on the user interface component presently selected, and finally default to show the hint on the best next step in the behavior graph. With the settings Bias Hints by Prior Error Only or Bias Hints by Current Selection Only, the tutor's first choice for a hint (before the default choice) will depend only on the student's prior error or present selection, respectively. With Always Follow Best Path, the tutor's choice for a hint will depend only on the behavior graph and ignore any prior error or current selection.

preference.name: Lock Widgets
preference.description: If this item is set, the widgets will not allow new input after the student has performed a correct action. Otherwise, a student may change a value after a correct answer.

preference.name: Highlight Right Widget
preference.description: If this item is set, then in ordered Example-Tracing tutors, a warning will be sent to the Student Interface if the student works on the wrong selection. The right selection will be highlighted.

preference.name: Group Dragging
preference.description: If this item is set, dragging one node in the graph will drag all child nodes as well. Otherwise, dragging one node will cause only that node to move.

preference.name: Set Preferred Path
preference.description: If this item is set, then the author can designate links in the graph as the preferred path. Otherwise, the author cannot change this designation.

preference.name: Enable Edge Traversal Counts
preference.description: If this item is set, then the Behavior Recorder will count link traversals in Demonstrate mode.

preference.name: Always Link States
preference.description: If this item is set, then in Demonstrate mode, the Behavior Recorder will never prompt the author about whether to link states when it detects that the current state of the student interface matches an existing state; instead, the Behavior Recorder will always link the matched states. If this item is unset, then the Behavior Recorder will prompt the author to ask whether to link to a matched state or to create a new state.

preference.name: Chain
preference.description: Turns on Chaining in the Jess Console.

preference.name: Firable
preference.description: Turns on Firable option in the Jess Console.

preference.name: Break on Exceptions
preference.description: Break when an exception occurs in the Jess Console.

preference.name: Tree Depth
preference.description: This item limits the number of times a rule can be chained in the Conflict Tree.

preference.name: Max Buggy Rules
preference.description: This item limits the number of bug rules displayed in the Conflict Tree.

preference.name: Use Salience
preference.description: This item instructs the production system to use salience.

preference.name: Match Parentheses
preference.description: If this item is selected the built-in Production Rule Editor will highlight matching parentheses. Use of this option may slow response time with medium-to-large rule files.

preference.name: Highlight Comments
preference.description: If this item is selected the Production Rule Editor will highlight comments in your code. Use of this option may slow response time with medium-to-large rule files.

preference.name: Highlight Keywords
preference.description: If this item is selected the Production Rule Editor will highlight keywords in your code. Use of this option may slow response time with medium-to-large rule files.

preference.name: Confirm Pre-commands
preference.description: Prompt the user before executing a pre-command.
